briefTitle: Safety and Tolerability of POD-DHE (INP104) in Migraine (STOP 301)
officialTitle: Open-label Study of Safety and Tolerability of Chronic Intermittent Usage for 24 or 52 Weeks of Intranasal Dihydroergotamine Mesylate (DHE) Administered Using the I123 Precision Olfactory Delivery (PODÂ®) Device [INP104, POD-DHE] in Patients With Migraine Headache

interventions.name: INP104
otherNames: Dihydroergotamine Mesylate (DHE) administered using the I123 Precision Olfactory Delivery (POD) Device

summary: This study consists of a 4-week screening period, a 24-week treatment period for all participants, followed by a 28-week treatment period extension (to 52 weeks in total) for a subset of at least 60 and up to 80 participants, and a 2-week post-treatment follow-up period.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From study enrollment up to Week 26 (for the 24-Week Treatment Group) and up to Week 54 (for the 52-WeekTreatment Group)
